newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan approves $95.86 mln China investment.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan approves $95.86 mln China investment.

text.p: Taiwan's Investment Commission approved on Monday 19 investment projects by its businessmen in China totalling $95.86 million.

The commission did not screen a $3 billion power plant project proposed by Formosa Plastics as the plastic giant withdrew the application last week after President Lee Teng-hui called for a review of economic policy towards China to avoid over-dependence on the mainland for investment.
Of the major approved projects, Chung Shing Textile planned to pour $10 million more into China for expansion of its textile plants in Shanghai, a commission statement said.
Tay Feng Tire was allowed to invest $9.69 million in China for tire and rubber product manufacturing.
The commission also gave the nod to a $9.5 million investment project by Mayer Steel Pipe Corp to make steel rolls and pipes in southern China.
Textile maker Chia Her Industrial would invest $9.31 million in a Shanghai plant and Master Home Furniture would invest $6 million in China for wooden furniture manufacturing.
